result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez

defendant.name: Colon-Rodriguez, Korey Danielle
defendant.address: 4012A West Good Hope Road, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court for Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties are still in negotiations.  Defense requests an adjournment.  Court rescheduled hearing. Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call/status.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Court ordered all subsequent hearings to be IN PERSON going forward.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a calendar call/status.  Court is in trial on another matter and rescheduled calendar call.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Calendar call scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/LIVE ON DACAST.

Attorney Amanda Poznanski in court.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for a scheduling conference.  Defendant appeared via Zoom prior to Court addressing this matter.  Due to connection difficulties of the defendant, Court scheduled an IN PERSON calendar call/status date.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Calendar call scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez in court with attorney Amanda Poznanski.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Carter Stores in Milwaukee County and Co-defendant Endeyah Jackson
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Korey Danielle Colon-Rodriguez in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 04/28/2022@01:30pm
